flavour: To understand the way of Moonglade, one had to learn a core principle underlying it all: take from the soil, return to the soil.

One scurried past us in a blur, and my guide instantly motioned for us to run as well.
"When you see one, you know the rest aren't far behind."
I may had been curious to see a scrambleweed stampede, but really not that curious.

The birds of prey in Moonglade are a tenacious breed for sure. The guide regaled to me stories of  them carrying entire mammoths in its talons up to its nest.
I searched his face for any telltale signs of a joke. There were none.
Eggs of the sun, they were called. A rotten bunch, is what I would call them.

The leaf inside pulsed with a bioluminescence I've never seen before.
It was life, unfiltered and undistiled, with all its miracles and all its mistakes. Almost as if I was staring straight through the looking-glass into the soul of Eona herself.
The horn they showed us was just a replica, but it didn't take away from the sheer majesty of it all the same.

The buds don't fall far from the world tree!
This is my journal. I can make as many bad jokes as I want. Who else is going to read it?
I don't know which one of them decided to use ketchup as a salad dressing but that was -clearly- never going to end well.

Our trek was a silent one beyond beaten paths, with her occasionally pointing at the strange flora around us. A flower that glows can be used to cure gout. The one with legs could be used as an aphrodisiac.
"And if you ever see a plant with teeth, you're already dead."

It stared at me with unblinking eyes, a maw of gleaming scimitars waiting for a naive traveller stupid enough to come close for a selfie.
I knelt down to give the tribute, walked out backwards, and made a mental note never to set foot in that temple again.

The aftermath was a brutal sight: trees hewn wantonly, the soil marred by the claw marks of a scratching, biting, gnashing legion.
I caught a view of them at the horizon as they rode off in a billowing dust cloud. To their next feeding grounds to strip bare, no doubt.
I was beginning to understand why the plants in Moonglade evolved to survive like they did.
The campmaster was offering me no other foods. I chose to go hungry.

As we grew more and more vigilant with our food provisions, the monkeys only grew craftier. By the third day, we had lost half of our rations from a joint operation of treetop fishing and midnight raiding..
If you yelled 'Tally ho!', the dog would run off to look for the nearest thing it considered edible. Most of the time it would be sticks, but that wasn't too bad either.
When I was a wee lass I used to chase the hapless chicks on the farm around to pass the time. Years later, it seemed these vengeful poultry still remember.
Wildberries can really help to calm the palate after eating your umpteenth dried caterpillar cocoon for breakfast.
Many days passed like this. A quiet sit by the campfire, staring back at red eyes in the shadows where the light did not touch.

flavor: I would have asked why a gorilla-manned eatery was lying in the middle of Stanglethorn, but at that point I was just happy we didn't need to catch something to eat anymore.
Wild Boarhowl. Tender yet crispy, melted in your mouth.
It was actually surprisingly effective against the monkey onslaught.

The gable was littered with stone statues, their faces eternally contorted in an expression of both surprise and agony.
"We had entered the cockatrice's den.

I vaulted over the 'DO NOT FEED WILDLIFE' sign and tossed a pile of picked bones at the hydra fledgling. What was the worst that could happen?, I had thought.
"Many hours and repeated rebellious acts later, my answer would be staring at me face-to-face-to-face-to-face from seventy feet high.

Now me own successful banana franchise, you see me enjoy fruits of me success.
"But it no always easy.Was tough for long time. Me had to eat insects from own fur because me was so poor.
"But me persevere. Me buy suspenders and bowler hat. Then when no one still come, me buy brass knuckles. Then people come. Me found successful business strategy!
"Buy me bananas! Or else.
It's a favourite amongst witches, but I was told it was a bit of an acquired taste. Can be a bit too strong to handle.

--'dearest consumable mind,
"you have been cordially invited for an afternoon of thistle delights, to indulge in madness reserved only for the most eldritch of proclivities. there will be assailing appendages moulded from pure and veritable terror. there will be all-encompassing oblivion laid bare beyond fathoming. there will be sponge cake.
"i look forward to your acquiescence.
"your lord and savior,
"yogg-saron'--
"Not everyday you get an invitation from an old god to a cafe. How can you refuse?
Arcane-prepared soup! It tasted . . . . a lot like regular-prepared soup, actually.
Dalaran Mages often spend a gap year away from the rigid confinements of academia by plying their unique trade in the catering industry.
A fruity tang lingered on my tastebuds, sizzling and popping.

In the menu, it claims it's 'electrolyte homeostasis' that provides the refreshing effect.
"By now, I'm sure you know that's just another word for 'magic'..
The amount of heat control needed to burn the cream just right before it scorches is a level of mastery nothing short of a dragon can achieve. Just our luck, then, that dragons really enjoy doing it.
Before I tried coffee, I thought I would have liked it strong and piping, like my soul. Now, I take it lukewarm, bitter and dull. Like my soul.
Witches on coffee break tend to be a bit . . . distracted.

Uppity, eccentric, tearing her customers apart with profanities that would make even my little brother blush.
"She really is as the TV show portrayed.

There really wasn't much room for anything else in the kitchen: something *big* ran across the gamut and took it all.
"It was an intricate network of crystal tubes and flasks, each filled with a different-colored solvent that popped, sizzled, and frothed in their own stoppered glass.
"I caught a glimpse of her through the fog of incense, her contours barely visible in the heavy mist, as well as a sign that read: 'MAGIC IN PROGRESS  (RESULTS MAY VARY)'.
The Goldshire faeries have served as housekeepers for the Songshine family for generations. They perform their tasks -- even ones as simple as spreading toast -- with a single-minded focus.
'It's not about if your neighbors have more. It's about if they have enough.' ~An old Goldshire proverb
Humility; it's the one virtue you can't really brag about.

She tossed a loaf my way. The fresh crunch of its crust as I dug my hands into it was like music to my ears.
"Hot off the oven. Everybody gets one free as a welcome gift.
"I could get used to this.
It singed all the way down my throat, blossoming in my gut and setting my veins aflame with an old, forgotten fire, rekindled.
I'm ashamed to say I took advantage of their generosity often.
Young talent is nurtured early here, with lots of leeway for experimenting.

With feigned casualness, I asked them if they did second dinner as well.
"The faeries replied with a wistful sigh of 'if only'.
There was no doubt from its weight and glisten: that egg was solid gold. What piqued my curiosity more was the glimpses of the creature that was slowly hatching from it.

She limped across the field with the rest of the children, bug-catching and shortbread her only immediate concerns in life.
"You never would have guessed her to be the next scion in line to inherit a powerful dynasty spanning centuries.

Holy cow! was my first thought.
"Then -- It's a holy cow!
It's nice to know that even in the higher echelons of the culinary world, a croissant is still a perfectly acceptable meal to enjoy.

Alas, mecca of high cuisine it may be, underage drinking was still a criminal offense.
"As a silver lining though, a single glass of that probably would have put me in debt for the rest of my life..
I picked to have a dragonburnt creme bu let with tartar steak. I think I caught the waiter sniggering behind my back.

name: Shadow Word: Flambe
flavor:
The idea is to burn off the unwanted strength of the alcohol while still keeping some flavor of the liquor.
"It's a hard to balance to get right, but of course in Le Prêtre, they would have abided by no lower standard.

name: Elune's Truffles
flavor:
Truffles are a fungus used in virtually all of haute cuisine, and lauded for its immense versatility. There are many kinds, such as the aptly-named white and black truffles.
"For some odd reason or another, I kept associating them with pigs..

name: Quatre Epices
flavor: The overpowering fragrance of the allspice, another ubiquitous element of Le Prêtre's cooking.

name: Box of Chocolates
flavor: No purer bliss than a girl with her chocolates.

name: Fine Dining
flavor:
We tapped our wineglasses together with a satisfying clink, chortling at the rubes and faux pas staring wistfully through the window.
"I hate to admit it, but it felt good.

name: Et Voila!
flavor:
The smallest dishes often came packed with the richest contents, as I soon came to find out. My ill-concealed disappointment turned into wonder the moment I popped the pastry into my mouth.
"The chef in turn did little to hide his smugness.

name: Cooking With Careme
flavor:
So I know what you're thinking: wow, how lucky I was to cook with the Supreme Chef!
"The truth was that I may have gone a bit over-budget with the dinner and thus had to work the debt off.

name: Talan
flavor:
Being a bartender is equal parts charm, equal parts mixing.
"Talan makes a heavenly cocktail, but I wouldn't mind being called mademoiselle every now and then.

name: Supreme Chef Careme
flavor:
'Attention, kitchen brigade! Please welcome our newest kitchen porter. She will be joining us this week as part of a promotion campaign from Cooking with Brode. Work her hard! Teach her the precision of Careme's Kitchen Brigade!
"~NB: Communard Festard, she is allergic to nuts. Please prepare a nut-free meal regime for her this week.'

name: Thick Glorp
flavor: I  gulped them down one by one, until the cacophony of screams, breaking glass and drum-shots blurred away into background noise.

name: Head Waiter
flavor: Undead made for cheap labour, so the sight of their festering limbs in my soup was regretfully pretty common.

name: Gruel Lunch Lady
flavor: The pot's strewn contents ate away at the plywood floor. And my metal spoon. And the jawbone of the undead gentleman next to me.

name: Spice Trade
flavor:
I'm not sure just exactly what kind of spice they were selling, but I know at the very least they were not supposed to fetch a street price in the triple digits per gram.
"I smelled a rat, and it wasn't that god awful broth that lunch lady was making.

name: Ground Mace Spice
flavor:
A pair of cutthroats in the corner of the tavern had been lathering their daggers with it.
"I don't think this was meant to be drunk.

name: Blackjack
flavor: What's dinner without a show?

name: Gilnean Barmaid
flavor: Dad, I'm sorry I didn't listen to you and took free drinks from a stranger.

name: Trip
flavor: I wasn't too sure what I was mumbling then. Something about vegetables? And bathing reptiles?

name: Gilnean Spikedrinker
flavor: Tip for future trips: Gilneas is not a place for tourists.

name: Captain Cookie
flavor:
His meat was rough and undercooked. His vegetables were rotten. It tasted like dirt.
"But it was the first real food I've eaten in this establishment.

name: Grand Snatcher Hessnia
flavor:
I had pieced it together by then. The quotation marks appending every food name. The bottom-table deals. The bosomed actresses prying your eyes away from it all.
"The Swinging Cutlass wasn't all what it seemed, this much even the most tight-lipped local would have told me.
"'We don't even bother to whisper -- we know she's listening,'they said in between drunken hiccups,'Leave a gap in the window blinds and if you're lucky, you might even catch a glimpse of her. The Swinging Cutlass is hers. And she takes what she wants from it.'
"I think I was lucky to have escaped alive that night. Or maybe the Grand Snatcher just allowed me to.

name: Fishmonger
flavor: The fish was so fresh, you could still see its gills gasping for air.

name: Tuskarr Feast
flavor: I never knew my stomach could dilate so much before.

name: Oasis Spring Totem
flavor: They stood as edifices of the people's gratitude, silent monuments that gave tribute to the ever-giving ocean and her bounty.

name: Ogre Chef
flavor:
Caution. This cookbook is for ages 7 and up. Aw, I can't count that high.
"I don't know how I can count that high when I'm illiterate.

name: Cloverload Spice
flavor: It was thick and congealing, with a consistency that reminded me of liquefied blubber.

name: Saucefin Panlicker
flavor: It munched on the pot, then donned it as a hat. To call that 'cooking' would have been a bit of a stretch.

name: Murloc Fin Recipe
flavor: One thing I learned about murlocs was that they were delicious. Another thing I learned was that most of the other animals thought so too.

name: Deviled Eggs Recipe
flavor: It's barbaric, I know, but it's also part of their culture. And there's nothing you can do about it. Maybe not take a picture like I did, I guess.

name: Whiskfury
flavor: Scholars of Al'Akir had preserved many secrets from the WIndlord that withstood the test of time. A lesser-known one was how to whisk with only one hand.

name: Tiki, Totem Spirit
flavor:
Storm - to bring the rain that nourishes our lands
"Earth - to hold the soil that feeds our crops
"and lastly, Fire - to bring light so that  we may flourish

name: Ozumat
flavor: Every now and then the abyss vomits out a peculiar thing to maroon onto the beaches. The people always send something of equal value to return back in appeasement. They rather not learn what happens if they didn't.

name: Funnel Cake Cook
flavor: Funnel cakes. The cause -- and solution -- to most of life's problems.

name: Funnelmancer
flavor: I think these guys are sentient balloons filled with funnel cake gas or something? I couldn't ask much; they popped if you tried to talk to them.

name: Engorge
flavor:
I was reassured that the victim was in fact a professional stunt actor wearing standard-issue safety gear.
"I mean, why would demons ever have a reason to lie to me?
"... They were genuinely eating that guy, weren't they?

name: Turn Into Soup
flavor: I could taste the eyeball. Not an experience I would like to relive anytime soon.

name: Impure Funnel Cake
flavor: If there's one word to describe funnel cake chefs, it would be 'neurotic'.

name: Void Glomper
flavor: Thralls of the Flavorlord , driven mad by the insatiable appetite of their master. It must be horrible to be hungry no matter how much you eat.

name: We Have To Cook
flavor:
I knew what I had to do, but my hands were trembling all the same.
"A single drop from this would eat through my skin down to the bone.
"'If you could make the perfect funnel cake, you will gain the favour of the Flavorlord. And once that happens, no one in the Undercity will touch you.'

name: Deep Fry
flavor: The oil they used was extracted from the gallbladder of a massive Nether Leviathan. No other substrate had a high enough evaporating point.

name: Cannibal Gourmet
flavor: Demon ichor had a certain ruddiness to them that human flesh lacked. At least, that was what I was told.

name: Dimensius the All-Devouring
flavor: I wasn't the first person to mistake Dimensius to be the almighty Flavorlord. But you could see a few of his widowed eyes twitch in the mention of that name.

name: Bomb Appetit
flavor: Flavorlord,  She Who Is Never Almost Out of Thyme.

name: Shrimpshell Bento
flavor: Eating its hard shell was said to give the fortitude necessary to endure a hard day's work.

name: Dragonroll Sushi
flavor: I couldn't come all the way here and not eat the one staple food the world knew them for, could I?

name: Iron Chef
flavor: 'Bitter. Wriggling. Pungent as a mastodon's breath. Just the way we like it.'

name: Whisketeer
flavor: For someone without opposable thumbs, they were surprisingly dextrous at holding the cooking utensils.

name: Wasabi Spice
flavor: It was stinging; overpowering even, like a brazen assault on all of my tastebuds.

name: Calamari of N'zoth
flavor:
A local delicacy which origins lay rooted in triumph against an ancient foe, and a mocking desire to literally rub salt in its wounds.
"'It actually does nothing for the taste,' the waiter shared as he sprinkled the salt shaker, 'But we know it stings him still.'

name: A Thousand Cuts
flavor: Incredulously, I asked if the name of the technique was just a figure of speech.'Of course! Don't be silly,' the head chef scoffed, mid-swing, 'It takes at least two or three thousand before the drakescale even begins to crack.'

name: Monster Platter
flavor: I was pretty sure half of the names on this menu had way too many consonants to be even remotely pronounceable.

name: Stovebelly Griller
flavor: With their love for breathing fire and how most of the food here came from underneath five-inch-thick iron hides, I guessed it would make sense why the stovebelly drakes had been domesticated for nearly two thousand years.

name: The Butcher
flavor: He diced the meat in a flurry of oft-practiced motion. Economical, but purposeful. All perfectly cut in equal sizes.

name: Ugaijin Ironhida
flavor:
Above me hung an iron-carved chandelier of the Prosperity God: 'With his igneous breath, he staves off the winter cold. With a buffet of his wings, he summons the monsoon rain.'
"My travelling partner bowed his head and mouthed the words. With a pointed glance from him, I promptly did the same.

name: Aletta Springcutter
flavor: Dad must have sneaked in a picture of me when I was distracted. He's a goofball, but I have to say it actually came out pretty nicely.

name: Ben Brode
flavor:
Thanks, Ben.
"I travelled the world, made new friends, and became a better person because of you.
"Wherever you're off to next, may you inspire them as much as you've done for me.
"And that's it for me. To everyone out there reading my travelogue, best wishes for your journeys, whatever they may be.
